provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not make any express or implied misrepresentations about the accuracy, efficacy, comparative bias performance, or liveness detection of its Facial Recognition Technology.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on Unsubstantiated Accuracy and Bias Claims
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any representation about the effectiveness, accuracy, lack of bias, or spoofing detection of its Facial Recognition Technology unless it possesses and relies upon competent and reliable testing that substantiates the claim at the time it is made.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgements of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the FTC, deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, employees, and agents, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, and submit timely notices within 14 days of changes to contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and sent to the designated FTC address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 15 years after issuance (retaining each for 5 years), covering financials, personnel, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, marketing materials, testing records, law enforcement communications, and evidence of non-compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, communicating directly with and interviewing affiliated personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover inquiries.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation — whichever is later — subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Ban on Sale or Disclosure of Browsing Information
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited from selling, licensing, or otherwise disclosing Browsing Information to Third Parties for Advertising Purposes, and from using Browsing Information for Advertising Purposes without Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Data Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all Jumpshot Data and any derived models, algorithms, or software within 20 days, instruct Third Parties to do the same, and provide sworn written statements confirming deletion to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Within 28 days of the effective date, Respondents must post a notice on their websites, notify users within affected Avast Products, and send the FTC-mandated Exhibit A Notice by email to affected users.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with third-party Assessors by providing all relevant information, disclosing network and IT asset details, and not misrepresenting any material facts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondents must pay $16,500,000 to the FTC within 9 days of the effective date of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondents relinquish all rights to transferred assets, agree that Complaint facts will be taken as true in any enforcement litigation, and acknowledge how unspent funds will be handled and the consequences of default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, file notices of material changes within 14 days, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filings, and submit all materials via the specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting compliance reports and records, communicating directly with Respondents, interviewing personnel, and using other lawful investigative means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging a violation of this Order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are banned from using facial recognition technology in retail stores, pharmacies, or online platforms for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all photos and videos collected from facial recognition systems and notify third parties to do the same.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any biometric surveillance system, Respondents must establish a comprehensive monitoring program to assess and mitigate risks of harm to consumers, including discriminatory impacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide written notice to consumers enrolled in biometric galleries or affected by system outputs, and establish complaint procedures with required response times.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must develop written retention schedules for biometric information with deletion timeframes no greater than 5 years unless required by law or with consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices disclosing use of biometric surveillance systems in all locations where they are deployed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from the CEO or senior officer confirming compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must report to the FTC any Covered Incidents affecting 500 or more consumers within 10 days of notifying government entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain signed acknowledgments of the Order from all relevant personnel and entities for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports and timely notices of any structural changes or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain records for 20 years documenting compliance with all provisions of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, depositions, document production, and interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Order supersedes the 2010 Decision and Order previously issued against Rite Aid.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited for five years from deploying or using any Facial Recognition or Analysis System in any retail store, retail pharmacy, or online retail platform.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all consumer photos and videos used with facial recognition systems within 45 days, notifythird parties and instruct them to delete within 60 days, and forward third-party deletion confirmations within 10 days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive monitoring Program that identifies and addresses consumer risks, including disproportionate impacts by race, ethnicity, gender, sex, age, or disability.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish and maintain procedures providing consumers with notice of Gallery enrollment and Output-based actions, and a process for submitting and responding to complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Before implementing any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must develop and implement a written retention schedule for each type of consumer Biometric Information, setting out purposes, a deletion timeframe of no greater than five years, and the basis for that timeframe.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the effective date, Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices in each retail location and on each website/app/online service disclosing their use of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems, including types of biometric data collected, outputs generated, purposes, and deletion timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: One year after issuance, and each year thereafter, Respondents must provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior executive confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected/undisclosed material noncompliance, and a description of all qualifying Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a detailed report to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, directors, subsidiaries, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports, compliance notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days of filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance through requests for reports and records, depositions, discovery, direct communications, interviews, and undercover methods, with Respondents obligated to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes and replaces the Commission's 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for individual provisions, non-defendant respondents, and dismissed complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Customer Notification About Dentrix G5 Encryption
provisions.summary: Respondent must clearly and conspicuously notify Affected Customers that Dentrix G5 uses a less complex encryption algorithm than AES, the NIST-recommended industry standard, following specific identification, mailing, and reporting procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Monetary Payment to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $250,000 to the Commission within eight days of the effective date of the order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Administration of Consumer Redress Fund
provisions.summary: Money paid to the Commission may be used for consumer redress or related relief; default on payment accrues interest and accelerates the full amount due; each day of nonpayment is a separate violation subject to civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Provision of Customer Information for Redress
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to efficiently administer consumer redress, and must supply any requested redress-related information within fourteen days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping of Advertising and Promotional Materials
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain all advertisements, supporting materials, and contradictory evidence related to any covered representation for five years after last dissemination, and make them available to the Commission upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with relevant managerial responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under the order, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report within sixty days of service of the order, and additional reports within ten days of written notice from a Commission representative.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on May 20, 2036, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notice and Affirmative Express Consent Provision
provisions.summary: Before using Biometric Information collected from a User to create a Face Embedding or train/develop/alter any face recognition model or algorithm, Respondent must clearly disclose all purposes for which it will use the information and obtain affirmative express consent from the User.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy photos, videos, Face Embeddings, and Affected Work Product collected from certain Users within specified timeframes after the Order's issuance, and provide sworn written statements to the Commission confirming such deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of this Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and successors, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, provide timely notices of changes in contact information or business structure, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified categories of records for 10 years after the Order's issuance, retaining each record for at least 5 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited for five years from deploying or using any Facial Recognition or Analysis System in any retail store, retail pharmacy, or online retail platform.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all photos, videos, and derived data used in connection with Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems prior to the order's effective date, notify third parties to do the same, and provide written confirmations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System (other than prohibited facial recognition), Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Monitoring Program to identify and address consumer risks, including risks of disproportionate harm based on race, ethnicity, gender, sex, age, or disability.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish and maintain procedures to provide consumers with notice of Gallery enrollment and of adverse actions taken based on Outputs, and must investigate and respond to consumer complaints within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Prior to implementing any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must develop and implement a written retention schedule for each type of consumer Biometric Information collected, specifying purposes, a deletion timeframe of no more than five years, and the basis for that timeframe.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the effective date, Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices in each physical retail location and on each website, mobile application, or online service disclosing the use of any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, including types of Biometric Information collected, types of Outputs generated, purposes for use, and retention timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from their CEO (or designated senior officer) confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents affecting 100 or more consumers during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a report to the Commission detailing the incident's date, facts, affected information types, number of affected consumers, remediation actions taken, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit their own acknowledgment of receipt within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to current and future principals, officers, relevant employees, subsidiaries, and agents for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit an initial sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices within 14 days of structural or contact changes or bankruptcy filings, and submit all required documents to the Commission via specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports, conducting depositions, obtaining records, communicating directly with Respondents, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using all other lawful means including undercover operations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes the Commission's prior 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and will terminate 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of this Order, whichever is later, with specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Required Deletion of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must identify all parties with whom GSRApp-collected Covered Information was shared, delete all such Covered Information and derived work product including algorithms, and provide sworn written confirmation of compliance to the Commission.

provisions.title: Duty to Protect Covered Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained and enjoined from disclosing, using, selling, or receiving any benefit from Covered Information or any information derived from Covered Information.

provisions.title: Access to Corporate Documents and Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must make all correspondence, financial data, documents, computer equipment, and electronically stored information available to the Commission for inventory and copying, must provide access credentials for any computer equipment or electronic data, and must notify the Commission before abandoning any corporate books or records.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order becomes final and effective 60 days after service and terminates on November 25, 2039, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation of the Order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Covered Information and Consumer Emails
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner how it accesses, collects, uses, stores, or shares Covered Information or Consumer Emails in connection with any Covered Product.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Required Notification About Consumer Email Access
provisions.summary: Respondent must directly notify all active Covered Consumers whose email purchase receipts are accessed for market research, by sending a specific email within 10 days of the Order's entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Required Deletion of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all stored email purchase receipts and associated Covered Information collected from Covered Consumers who enrolled prior to June 1, 2017, within 10 days of the Order's entry, unless the consumer provides affirmative express consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission and deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel, then collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, submit timely notices of any material changes in contact information or corporate structure, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific business, personnel, consumer complaint, user-interface, and compliance records for prescribed periods of up to 10 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using undercover methods, including posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order becomes final upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date a federal court complaint alleging a violation is filed, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act
